column1: Other
column2: Johnny3h, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: For 25+ years I worked as a Firefighter [2 years], a Fire Inspector [5 years], and for 20 more years an Investigator/Expert Witness regarding the Origin & Cause of Fire/Arson/Explosions.As a result, I have been burned many times.  The first time it happened, the Doctor prescribed silver sulphadiazine AS A PROPHYLATIC [PREVENTIVE] for infection.  I did not have an infecction, but used it according to label directions until the wound had healed [a remarkable 10 days to full healing].As I used only a small amount from the container, I saved it and continued to use it for burns, cuts, scratches.  I would wash the wound immediately after occurance, and then would apply the silver sulphadiazine, and continue to wash and apply 2 to 4 times a day.The amazing thing to me was the extremely FAST healing, usually 4 to 7 days, when ordinary washing and use of ordinary over the counter medications would require several days to heal.In the almost 35 years since that time I have managed to obtain and save three of the small plastic jars and they have carried me through hundreds, if not thousands, of minor scrapes, scratches,cuts, and burns without once resulting in any infection.I have been totally "sold" on silver sulphadiazine since day one.Although it generally has had exparation dates less than 3 years from prescription issue, I have used it when it was several years old, and have never noticed any degradation of effectiveness.Again, this is outstanding stuff.  I've tried to find out what is so dangerous about this product that would cause it to require a prescription, but I've never, ever gotten what I consider a decent answer to this question.

column1: Minor Skin Infection caused by Bacteria

column9: i just started this medication i had 2 large bumps on my neck just where i had finised radiation tretment for vocal chord cancer, i went to a skin dr. he said it was a ingrown hair, and ordered a antibiotic, it did not work then he sent me to an infectious desease dr. he ordered a cream and said it was an ingrown hair also, yesterday i went to my oncoligist to look at it and he squeesed it and a lot of puss came out and he said it was a hair and he tried to get it with a pair of tweesers and no luck, so he told me to apply heat 2 times a day and put on this silver sulfadiazine, so this is only my 2nd day, hope it works.  augie
